New Records: Pakistan recorded the highest successful run chase in Cricket World Cup history
Key Match Events: Centuries from Kusal Mendis (122) and Sadeera Samarawickrama (108) helped Sri Lanka set a total of 344 for nine
Abdullah Shafique (113) and Mohammad Rizwan (131 not out) hit centuries of their own to give their side a second successive victory
Dilshan Madushanka aimed to disrupt proceedings when he dismissed Imam-ul-Haq and the skipper, Babar Azam, early on
Miscellaneous Highlights: The wicketkeeper Mendis and the No 4, Samarawickrama, were also in blistering form
Others: Rizwan, who hit 11 boundaries, rounded off a remarkable match as he struck the winning runs to confirm a historic victory
